text: Amnesty International highlight six
attacks in Syria with dozens of civilian
casualties in each case there was no
obvious military target nearby after
interviewing witnesses doctors and human
rights groups analysts see reports that
Homs and a hospital were hit as well as
a market and a mosque in most cases the
location and timing of the attacks tally
with Russian Defense Ministry reports on
airstrikes though it says it was
targeting so-called Islamic state
militants despite dropping thousands of
bombs in Syria Russian officials have
never acknowledged causing any civilian
casualties there they extol effective
pinpoint strikes against terrorists and
have dismissed previous claims to the
contrary as part of an anti-russian
information war by the West but this
latest investigation which includes
analysis of video material from strike
sites also highlights the unlawful use
of unguided bombs and cluster munitions
in built-up areas unless the
International is calling for an
immediate end to what it describes as
indiscriminate and disproportionate
strikes in Syria and for a full
investigation into what's happened there
so far
